Mouse And Keyboard Actions: The other three actions here refer to the virtual keyboard. If you require text or numeric input in your game on a touchscreen device, then you can use the virtual keyboard actions provided to use the device OS keyboard. These actions will call up or hide the OS keyboard and accept input from it just the same as a physical keyboard, so the regular GameMaker Studio 2 keyboard actions should all work with virtual keyboards (for example, the "If Key Released" action), and any input from the virtual keyboard will be stored in the different keyboard variables, like keyboard_string or keyboard_last_char, etc...).
